TranslationPCE¶

public class TranslationPCE¶

Methods¶

createFixtureAndResources¶

public ReservedVlanFixtureE createFixtureAndResources(String portUrn, EthFixtureType fixtureType, Integer azMbps, Integer zaMbps, Set<Integer> vlanIds, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

Create a Reserved Fixtures and it’s associated resources (VLAN and Bandwidth) using the input.

Parameters:
  • portUrn –
    • The URN of the desired fixture
  • fixtureType –
    • The typing of the desired fixture
  • azMbps –
    • The requested ingress bandwidth
  • zaMbps –
    • The requested egress bandwidth
  • vlanIds –
    • The assigned VLAN IDs
  • start –
    • The requested start date
  • end –
    • The requested end date
Returns:

The reserved fixture, containing all of its reserved resources

createJunctionAndFixtures¶

public ReservedVlanJunctionE createJunctionAndFixtures(TopoVertex device, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Map<String, DeviceModel> deviceModels, Set<RequestedVlanJunctionE> requestedJunctions, Map<String, Set<Integer>> vlanMap, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

Create a Junction and it’s associated fixtures given the input parameters.

Parameters:
  • device –
    • The device vertex associated with the junction
  • urnMap –
    • A mapping of URN strings to URN objects
  • deviceModels –
    • A mapping of URN strings to Device Models
  • requestedJunctions –
    • A set of requested junctions - used to determine attributes of junction/fixtures
  • vlanMap –
    • Map of assigned VLANs for each fixture
  • start –
    • The requested start date
  • end –
    • The requested end date
Throws:
  • PSSException –
Returns:

A Reserved Vlan Junction with Reserved Fixtures (if contained in a matching requested junction)

createReservedBandwidth¶

public ReservedBandwidthE createReservedBandwidth(String urn, Integer inMbps, Integer egMbps, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

Create the reserved bandwidth given the input parameters.

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The URN associated with this bandwidth
  • inMbps –
    • The ingress bandwidth
  • egMbps –
    • The egress bandwidth
  • start –
    • The requested start
  • end –
    • The requested end
Returns:

A reserved bandwidth object

createReservedBandwidthForEROs¶

public Set<ReservedBandwidthE> createReservedBandwidthForEROs(List<TopoVertex> az, List<TopoVertex> za, Map<TopoVertex, Map<String, Integer>> requestedBandwidthMap, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

Given two lists of EROS in the AZ and ZA direction, a map of URNs, a map of the requested bandwidth at each URN, and the requested schedule, return a combined set of reserved bandwidth objects for the AZ and ZA paths

Parameters:
  • az –
    • The AZ vertices
  • za –
    • The ZA vertices
  • requestedBandwidthMap –
    • A mapping of Vertex objects to “Ingress”/”Egress” requested bandwidth
  • start –
    • The requested start date
  • end –
    • The requested end date
Returns:

A set of all reserved bandwidth for every port (across both paths)

createReservedFixture¶

public ReservedVlanFixtureE createReservedFixture(String urn, Set<ReservedPssResourceE> pssResources, Set<ReservedVlanE> rsvVlans, ReservedBandwidthE rsvBw, EthFixtureType fixtureType)¶

Create a reserved fixture, given the input parameters.

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The fixture’s URN
  • pssResources –
    • The fixture’s PSS Resources
  • rsvVlans –
    • The fixture’s assigned VLAN IDs
  • rsvBw –
    • The fixture’s assigned bandwidth
  • fixtureType –
    • The fixture’s type
Returns:

The Reserved VLAN Fixture

public ReservedVlanJunctionE createReservedJunction(String urn, Set<ReservedPssResourceE> pssResources, Set<ReservedVlanFixtureE> fixtures, EthJunctionType junctionType, Set<ReservedVlanE> reservedVlans)¶

Create a reserved junction given the input

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The junction’s URN
  • pssResources –
    • The junction’s PSS Resources
  • fixtures –
    • The junction’s fixtures
  • junctionType –
    • The junction’s type
Returns:

The Reserved VLAN Junction

public ReservedVlanE createReservedVlan(String urn, Integer vlanId, Date start, Date end)¶

Create the reserved VLAN ID given the input parameters.

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The URN associated with this VLAN
  • vlanId –
    • The ID value for the VLAN tag
  • start –
    • The requested start time
  • end –
    • The requested end time
Returns:

The reserved VLAN objct

createReservedVlanForEROs¶

public Set<ReservedVlanE> createReservedVlanForEROs(List<TopoVertex> az, List<TopoVertex> za, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Map<String, Set<Integer>> vlanMap, Date start, Date end)¶

Given two lists of EROS in the AZ and ZA direction, a map of URNs, a chosen vlan ID, and the requested schedule, return a combined set of reserved VLAN objects for the AZ and ZA paths

Parameters:
  • az –
    • The AZ vertices
  • za –
    • The ZA vertices
  • urnMap –
    • A mapping of URN string to URN object
  • vlanMap –
    • A mapping of URN object to assigned VLAN ID
  • start –
    • The requested start date
  • end –
    • The requested end date
Returns:

A set of all reserved VLAN objects for every port (across both paths)

reserveRequestedPipe¶

public void reserveRequestedPipe(RequestedVlanPipeE reqPipe, List<TopoEdge> azERO, List<TopoEdge> zaERO, List<ReservedBandwidthE> reservedBandwidths, List<ReservedVlanE> reservedVlans, Set<ReservedMplsPipeE> reservedMplsPipes, Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedEthPipes, Map<String, Set<String>> deviceToPortMap, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

Create a set of reserved pipes/junctions from a requested pipe. A requested pipe can produce: One pipe for each pair of Ethernet devices One pipe for each MPLS segment along the path This function will add to the reservedMplsPipes and reservedEthPipes sets passed in as input

Parameters:
  • reqPipe –
    • THe requested pipe, containing details on the requested endpoints/bandwidth/VLANs
  • azERO –
    • The physical path taken by the pipe in the A->Z direction
  • zaERO –
    • The physical path taken by the pipe in the Z->A direction
  • reservedBandwidths –
    • The list of all bandwidth reserved so far
  • reservedVlans –
    • The list of all VLAN IDs reserved so far
  • reservedMplsPipes –
    • The set of all reserved MPLS pipes so far
  • reservedEthPipes –
    • The set of all reserved Ethernet pipes so far
  • deviceToPortMap –
  • portToDeviceMap – @throws PCEException
Throws:
  • PSSException –

reserveRequestedPipeWithPairs¶

public void reserveRequestedPipeWithPairs(RequestedVlanPipeE reqPipe, List<List<TopoEdge>> azEROs, List<List<TopoEdge>> zaEROs, List<ReservedBandwidthE> reservedBandwidths, List<ReservedVlanE> reservedVlans, Set<ReservedMplsPipeE> reservedMplsPipes, Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedEthPipes, Map<String, Set<String>> deviceToPortMap, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

reserveSimpleJunction¶

public ReservedVlanJunctionE reserveSimpleJunction(RequestedVlanJunctionE req_j, List<ReservedBandwidthE> reservedBandwidths, List<ReservedVlanE> reservedVlans, Map<String, Set<String>> deviceToPortMap, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap, Date start, Date end, String connectionId)¶

Creates a ReservedVlanJunctionE given a request for ingress/egress traffic within a device.

Parameters:
  • req_j –
    • The requested junction
  • deviceToPortMap –
    • Map from each device name to set of port names
  • portToDeviceMap –
    • Map from each port name to parent device name
  • start –
    • The requested start date
  • end –
    • The requested end date
Throws:
  • PSSException –
  • PCEException –
Returns:

The Reserved Junction

public void testBandwidthRequirements(RequestedVlanPipeE reqPipe, List<TopoEdge> azERO, List<TopoEdge> zaERO, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Integer azMbps, Integer zaMbps, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap, Map<TopoVertex, Map<String, Integer>> requestedBandwidthMap, List<ReservedBandwidthE> reservedBandwidths)¶
